pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:0.5: 43. The training rule on spinning yarn
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.2: the nuns from the group of six were spinning yarn.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.3: When people walking about the dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.4: “How can the nuns spin yarn? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.5: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.6: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.7: “How can the nuns from the group of six spin yarn?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.11: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.13: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.14.1: ‘If a nun spins yarn, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.1.6: there are six kinds of yarn:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.1.7: linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.1.9: if she spins it herself, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.1.10: For every pull, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.2.2: if she spins thread that has already been spun;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.2.4: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.2.5: The third training rule is finished.
